concept.title: Management Console Scaling Overview
concept.shortdesc: Cloud administrators can deploy the Eucalyptus Management Console in a cloud-compatible VM so that a console can scale to meet the demands of users and customers. Just as imaging, ELB, and workers are done currently, delivering the console inside an image provides the ability to eliminate work performed within the console itself.

conbody.p:
Deploying the console this way achieves several things, which are important:
consistent with delivery of other services
no configuration of the console required, as all configuration can be automated with launching an instance
no artificial restriction on console dependencies
console having an identity in the system — through a console account and IAM instance profile-based credentials — to call euca:service operations
The following are limitations that exist today. Deploying the console behing an ELB makes possible the following, which are not possible otherwise:

ul.li: isolated network environment with system-enforced network restrictions
self-configuration when the system changes (due to UFS)
domain naming support for a fixed console endpoint (e.g., console.eucalyptus.subdomain.com)
auto scaling based on console-controlled triggers
possibility of non-trivial topologies for the console (e.g., with a shared service of some kind)
